page.title: 01BLAYDON AND WINLATON
page.content: Blaydon and Winlaton lie on the south bank of the River Tyne 7km west of the centre of Newcastle upon Tyne. Blaydon is situated on the floodplain of the river, while Winlaton is sited at a height of 133m above the valley floor. Blaydon has a population of 9,942 and Winlaton 8,683. The history of the area is bound up with that of coal mining and iron industries. This industrial base has completely disappeared , and consequently unemployment is over 15%, and over 20% for 16_19 year olds. Blaydon still has light industrial plants, but Winlaton is a commuter village serving Tyne & wear. Both places have modern traffic free shopping precincts, and are well served by road and rail links to Newcastle and Hexham.
